title: Uninstalling League
body:
I'm a lifetime gamer and have been a player since Beta and I can tell you I have never been treated so terribly by a game creator as by Riot Games. 

I bought this game on a CD-Rom from GameStop it was so long ago and I've logged hundreds of thousands of hours of gameplay over the course of 10 years. I've had no serious issues and always had the same one account for 9 years. That account got banned in the period of 3 weeks because I said the f word (I'm gay and I say it all the time in real life and will continue to say it). I've never been banned from any game or anything else in my entire life.

I disagreed on it being worth a perm ban, but understood the reasoning behind it and made a second account I would refrain from using banned words on. Since then, Riot has implemented in their banning/punishment system regarding the chat log is that either one 'banned' (but still sharable?) word or a handful of instances of not being nice enough critiquing gameplay and they'll put temp and perm bans on your account.

I'm completely over it and uninterested giving this company anymore of my time or money unless they fix their chat/banning system.  

The toxicity situation in League is only going to get worse as the number of non-chat trolls will grow and legit players will get frustrated and leave. Yes, you can get banned for non-chat toxic gameplay, but it's much, much less likely and toxic gameplay happens all the time. Chat however will auto-trigger from catchphrases. 

I still have a playable account, but after being recently temp banned for responding to a group of people actively griefing me in game, I refuse to be actively abused anymore while riot waits to ban me for reacting.

I remember a time in gaming where you either got banned for something actually serious or by a childish moderator. Sadly, that time is over and now we have a monster of a system that lets you get berated and harassed unless you mute everyone all the time or you're forced to take it. 

I'm ending this abusive relationship and honestly, I think it will be for the better.

I've played a lot of league, and it's pretty rare when someone decides to use slurs or threats. If you're level 92, you've been around long enough to know others don't use this language frequently. 

If you're really leaving the community, then fine; I'm sorry this game's system with regards to chat doesn't suit you. But if you are going to come back after your 2-week suspension, then you should know that the next punishment is a permanent ban.

This isn't my main. My main was the one perma banned for a slur. I said I understood that. That was my 10 year account.

This is my new account. It was temp banned after almost a year of no issues for me responding to a duo attacking me. I don't feel temp and perm bans are appropriate for chat especially after only 1 or 2 chat restrictions. 

I have no idea how I get toxic player after toxic player dropping slurs, afking, in-game griefing, and flaming and somehow I get temp ban. Are all these players getting perm banned back to back after my games with them? Something isn't adding up.

Isn't your own chat logs evidence that players are held responsible for their actions? 

Punishments have to fit the infractions committed. You afk, you get leaver buster (eventually getting a suspension if it's chronic), you intentionally feed or use slurs, you get suspended, your chat's negative, and you get a chat restriction. Failure to heed warnings, and you get permabanned. 

There's opportunities to reform. If you don't agree with, at the very least, being neutral in your games, then I'm afraid you'll just keep ending up here discussing your most recent permanent ban.

And honestly, what is up with the state of this forum? Riot has no reasonable place to discuss issues with the punishment system and the one place Riot realistically has to have a conversation about it is filled with a handful of people making negative, rude comments. This is terrible customer service. Why are you OK with some of the toxic behavior coming from people criticizing those who want to change the system? You removed my post as uncivil, but someone saying 'I'm a problem riot wont have to deal with anymore' isn't toxic or uncivil? Seriously?

You and the other poster were having an uncivil conversation that was not related to the OP. It was without a warning. You should just disengage with other posters if you find their behavior to be negative, and report it if you feel inclined.

It was without a warning, but their negative comments still stand. So basically you're currently doing exactly what I claim the chat ban system is doing. Dealing with players for calling out negativity and then not fixing the negativity. 

There's still a comment in this thread that says " League no longer has to deal with a toxic player so League will be happier. " in direct regards to me as a personal attack. The person in question during that conversation and the one in this one can be seen across the forum mocking and being rude and his comments are still there and you've commented around him in several of them.

So basically Riot tolerates specific forms of toxicity and those people get a pass at not being dealt with or punished. It's happening right now on this forum and you can see it. Passive-aggressive, rude, and belittling comments are toxic and they're all over this forum.

This is my main point. The term toxic is vague and allows certain people to skirt the system and others, who are otherwise fun and nice players, to get special attention for possible punishment.

Is there anything that will come from me bringing this to your attention? It seems like Riot policy is set.

Please continue to report comments that you see unfit for the boards and we will look into them.

Of course everyone can always be a better person in game, I would never deny that, and the idea of chat punishments for specific things is a good idea such as slurs or threats.

However, 

- The chat ban system jumps quickly to temp and perm bans and doesn't seem to care much about reform and actually whirlpools you into bans faster if you ever touch it. 

- The chat ban system is too harsh on players who defend themselves from trolls. It vaguely targets negativity. 

- The chat ban system has gotten much more strict because in 10 years of playing, only recently have I had any issues and I've specifically worked to avoid curse words and flaming. 

- Riot doesn't seem to have any outlet or care at all about people being pelted with toxicity and reacting to it.

- There must be 1 or more people each game I play in ranked getting a temp or perm ban if what you're saying about accountability is true. Are your ban rates seriously that high?

I get the rules and understand your points, but it doesn't add up when you get into ranked league and it's a toxic dumpster fire.

If you no longer find the game fun and the last of your account are about to be perma-banned along with your main, it is good for your mental health and the the health of League community for you to quit.  You will be happy to move on to other games or other things that make you happier.  League no longer has to deal with a toxic player so League will be happier.  it's a win-win.

I'm aware the forums here are mostly filled with people who support League's decisions no matter what and down-vote anything that is against them, but the health of the League community has become worse because Riot punishes randomly. It's ridiculous to say a player of 10 years should be perm banned on 2 accounts based on a handful of instances responding to online abuse all within the last year. That's how to spot a poor punishment system.

Even if I wanted to 100% "reform" right now, even the slightest misstep of critiquing game play could be considered toxic and I be perm banned. There is no clear rule on how to communicate besides a vague concept of toxicity and somehow there are clearly toxic players in most games.

What Riot does is the equivalent of a coffee shop banning someone for being upset someone else threw a drink in their face. It's insane.

The rules are pretty clear.  Don't be toxic, don't be a dick, and don't use zero tolerance word (whether you believe it should be ZT or not).  I may not have 10 years under my belt like you, I do play since Season 3 and have not gotten so much as a warning or chat restriction and I do play ALL games modes (RIP dominion) including ranked.  I have every Victorious skins since Season 4 onward to show for it.  So while I admit I did missed Season 1, 2, and the early Season 3, I am not seeing this decline in League or rise in toxicity that you claim.  I play 5,6 days a week averaging 10+ games a week ever since Season 3 across ALL game modes from co-op vs AI (for missions) to ranked solo/flex and everything in between.

The punishment is not random.  The fact that it is more or less 100% automated for chat toxicity means it is the least random punishment system you'll ever find.  Old Tribunal is random.  If you give people a chat log one day and give them the exact same chat log a week later, the % vote to punish will vary.  That's because human is random.  The Instant Feedback System works off of the exact same algorithm that judges a chatlog today the exact same way it judges the same chat log next week.  That is not random.  The IFS is incapable of being bias or have emotions or just decide on its own to punish people more any particular day of the week like a human would.

I do not support League's decisions no matter what.  Most notably I really think their random feedback notice philosophy is bullshit.  Either make it 100% reliable and send us feedback notice every single report we make or just do away with it completely and send nothing like the old days.  If you put aside your bias of the board for a moment and you will notice many others including Specialists and mods and board regulars who do criticize and against one or more part of League's behavior system.  They most certainly do not auto downvote anything that is against them.  I have not vote on your thread one way or the other for example.

Whether you are in a coffee shop or a super market or a movie theater or a bar, if you start being upset and yell at another customer(s) and most especially throwing slurs, homophobic, and racist comments telling other to kill themselves, you will likely see both you and the other customer being thrown out of that venue.  It is hardly insane.  2 customers yelling at each other is bad for business and no business will allow the shouting match to continue uninterrupted in their place of business.

The tribunal existed and was fair because it looked at the entire situation. When someone entered the game flaming people, chat demonstrated they griefed in-game, and then people responded, it was clear which player was the one ruining the experience. The ones responding could just be robots, pop a xanax, and mute themselves, but they were not the players ruining the game.

I understood the 'no tolerance' on word use, thought I thought a perm ban was a very high teir and unfitting punishment. I do not however understand that being thrown around the room like Karthus skittles at anyone who says something impolite. 

To be totally honest, I think Riot profits from this system because they put on a 'no tolerance' policy and get someone to rebuy all their champions and skins while pretending they did it to better the game. The state of the game has gotten no better and if anything, is worse now because you can get banned after getting harassed by toxic players.

> The tribunal existed and was fair because it looked at the entire situation. When someone entered the game flaming people, chat demonstrated they griefed in-game, and then people responded, it was clear which player was the one ruining the experience. The ones responding could just be robots, pop a xanax, and mute themselves, but they were not the players ruining the game.

And yet, those people who responded to toxicity with their own toxicity consistently get punished too.  I participated in the old Tribunal very actively (before the IP reward incentive and after it got removed).  There had been many instances where I did feel the person was being pushed and and just let out a rant of frustration and I voted to pardon.  I consistently was in the minority for those pardon and my accuracy rates suffered for it.  That's something people who wants Tribunal to come back doesn't realize it.  People WILL vote to punish you if you flame back and no amount of pardon you vote will change the majority (RIP accuracy rates).

> I understood the 'no tolerance' on word use, thought I thought a perm ban was a very high teir and unfitting punishment. I do not however understand that being thrown around the room like Karthus skittles at anyone who says something impolite. 

Rito does not punished you on the first ZT you threw.  You have 2 chances before that perm ban.  How many times do people have to tolerate you throwing slurs around before they say enough is enough?

> To be totally honest, I think Riot profits from this system because they put on a 'no tolerance' policy and get someone to rebuy all their champions and skins while pretending they did it to better the game. The state of the game has gotten no better and if anything, is worse now because you can get banned after getting harassed by toxic players.

No.  They put on a no ZT policy is because no one wants to see slurs, hate speech, homophobic, racism, etc. in their games.  The fact that they have no real viable ways (that doesn't cause collateral damage) to prevent you from making new account in their free-to-play model doesn't mean they doing it on purpose.  Let me ask you this.  If you buy a ticket for a movie.  What insane mind think it's a good business model to throw customers out in the middle of the movie in hope they will come back to buy a 2nd ticket for the same movie.  Or better question, what insane person DO come back to buy a 2nd ticket for the same movie when they got thrown out of the first one and at risk of that happening again before they can finish the movie?

I have never understood this conspiracy theory.  Why would someone who got perm-banned come back and spend even more money on a game they got permed and at risk of getting permed again.  Why would someone who got perm-banned make new accounts to spend more money for a company they very much disagree with?  League is hardly the only multi-player game.  It is hardly the only MOBA game out there.

---

Have you consider that you got perma-banned because you are toxic and not because of League's system?

Tribunal is only seen as something good through those nostalgia glasses.   It had many problems and was actually very inefficient way of handling the community, especially since you could sit there and just click "yes" or "no" on whatever without actually reading anything.

The Instant Feedback System has actually proven to be a much better system overall. It continues to cut down the toxicity in the game.
I honestly have yet to see a drop of toxicity in league. Yes, there's reasons you might remember bad games more, but it's very very common still.

"It's ridiculous to say a player of 10 years should be perm banned on 2 accounts based on a handful of instances responding to online abuse all within the last year. That's how to spot a poor punishment system." 

I respond to abusive behavior all the time and have played for an equal amount of time - Never once have i been banned. Why? Because i respond in a manner that does not cross a line of TOS which you clearly have a issue with. 

I'm far from a "fan-boy" i can say without question its a good thing you got banned - It tells me the system is working as intended. The choice to respond with hateful intent was your choice, no one forced you to do so. If you're having a bad day or got triggered because of some random player, then you have the right to report them, turn the game off, or mute them. It sounds to me like you need to take more responsibility for you own actions instead of blaming the system you so poorly chose to defy. 

Be the change for a positive environment instead of the reason abuse systems are needed and perhaps you'll find a better gaming experience.

And yet my account punishments only began after new changes of Riot sloppily 'fixing toxicity' by adding a robot to searching for catch phrases and auto-punish.

I'm happy for you that you enjoy your game the way you do and it seems to work with Riot's decisions. 

It doesn't make it correct to punish others for responding to a known, major toxic issue in the game. As has been said many times, players like myself who had a long-standing main perma banned engaged in a massive number of fun, positive, encouraging games with no issues. I came back from the hospital last week and have been playing league daily with many new, added friends and positive experiences. 

To say that because I didn't word something politely enough to someone who flamed in chat, engaged in in-game trolling (and admitted it in chat), afkd, and then reported me after to get me banned is deserving of a temp ban which is known to lead to a perm ban? No. The bullies are running the school now.

1. Not how the robot works.

2. The system hasn't really changed - the rules were and still are based on tribunal votes.

Well, why when I never made any changes to my behavior, in fact I made a larger effort to avoid arguements, did I get a temp ban so quickly after a long time of no issues? It was completely a surprise to me to have gotten it.

1. You did make changes to your behavior. Hence why you were punished.

2. You did not have "no issue until the robot". You had no issue until you began misbehaving.

3. It doesn't matter who "instigated" it. It matters who behaved bad. Period. Even if that is multiple players.
In addition, my original account had no issue until the robot. All in all, players are getting more random punishments when they're not the instigators of the poor behavior.

It's also funny that you responded with a toxic comment of passive aggressively telling me I'm wrong by adding 'League won't have to deal with you'. This is more of that under the radar behavior that Riot allows their customers to get berated with while punishing responses.

You need to get something clear.  In-game behavior and board behavior are not governed by the same rules.  In-game toxicity is covered by the ToS while the ToS does not necessarily covered this board.  The universal rules does. https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/community-moderation/ITFIpNUE.  If you feel my comment is toxic, feel free to report it (the button is on the lower right corner of my comment.  You are not comparing apples to apples to begin with.
I'm not looking to ban you, I'm saying you're being toxic right now while calling me toxic.
well, normal people don't get 2 different accounts banned for no reason...

As that may be your opinion, the topic here is why they were banned and you replied with a passive aggressive comment implying people wouldn't have to 'deal with me'. It appears you likely dodge toxic chat in-game because of being passively toxic yourself.

Nice theory, but when I play the game, I focus on the game and my in-game chat is game-related.  Every so often I find someone to shoot the breeze with during champ select or load out waiting for blue to spawn.  If the punishment is so random and your theory applies, don't you think over the many thousands games I play, I would had been punished by now?

You came into a discussion about game rules with a passive aggressive comment that attacked my character. I have been nothing but courteous. You showed your personality to be one of instigating things with a borderline comment and then claiming moral superiority which Riot doesn't punish. You wouldn't expect to see a ban saying a slight underhanded comment like that which you know you said with a negative attitude, please stop pretending it wasn't.
Agree with you 100%. I'm quitting this game until they A. stop treating their 2nd or 3rd biggest server like a fucking trashcan and B. actually fix their dumb ban system

I got a 14-day-ban on an account that had not gotten 1 punishment before, said no slurs, didn't swear, nothing. When I posted here about it, people responded saying my ban was justified because I was being annoying. Because being annoying is most certainly an offence. Riot needs context, and they need actual humans policing it. I'm done with this game. All I use it for is income right now.
It’s a disaster and these forums show how bad of one it is. Having a handful of rude users berate people trying to discuss issues? Shame on riot for allowing this.

100%. The boards are a mess. Around 6 months ago I was literally witch hunted because of one questionable post I made, to the point that every post I made was downvoted and I was harassed, and my reports to the offenders did absolutely nothing just like they do in game. I ended up having to use a different account for the boards just so I wouldn't get harassed whenever I tried to make a post. What a disgrace this community is.

Exactly! And we see the exact same behavior in-game. Certain people have learned how to use Riot's system to troll normal players and now we get a new normal player in here every day who got banned for responding to them. These forums do absolutely nothing to honestly reform anyone because the only legit way to avoid banning is just muting and not using chat. Aka, the chat system doesn't work.

It's not a competitive chat if you can't tell your teammates they aren't playing correctly or criticizing behavior, especially harder to report behavior. If you can't do that then they just need to remove chat like other games that don't want to deal with it.

If a game isnt satisfying, why play it? Its YOUR free time. No one is paying you to play, and youre basically just wasting time in an enjoyable way. If its not enjoyable, do something else. Have fun, hope ya find a good game! (I prefer sc2 co-op mode)

Just leave them alone and let them destroy themselves, let them drug themselves to the grave. Why should you try and tell them that you arent happy with what they have become. Why should you waste YOUR precious time to get your friend or relative off thier drug addiction. Stop whining about how they are destroying themselves because being around them is no longer enjoyable. 

Yeah, dont waste your time trying to fix a drug-addicted friend/family member, someone you spend alot of time with. Just let them destroy themselves and go off to do something more enjoyable.

Just go find another game and let the game destroy itself. Let it fall into its death spiral as More people leave, the time between matches gets longer and longer. None of the problems are solved, so more people leave...the game looks worse and worse. 

But hey, why should people who enjoyed the game as it once was try to get it back to its former glory. Just stop complaining right? if you dont like the game? Dont play it! Just ignore it as it destroys itself. 

Nice logic. People who grew up with league and dont like what it has become, those who can see it pretty much destroying itself.. They should just shut up and stop "complaining" about obvious serious flaws in the game driving players away and contributing to a death spiral. 
Cuz fixing something they grew up with that is being ruined is "not worth your time"

RiP League. 
I am a season 3 player, I already uninstalled. 
I am just here to watch the game burn. I do not foresee a chance of recovery.

There's a lot of factors going into whether you should help your friend or not. Lots of schools of thought. Is it yyour business? Is that friend important to you? Do they have anything to offer you in return? Do you feel you need a return? Do you feel you have a dutyto help? Maybe explore the idea of what you are and arent responsible for?
